      • qrem.characterization
      • qrem.cn
      • qrem.common
        • This subpackage qrem.common provides a suite of utility modules specifically tailored for the QREM project. It encompasses a range of functionalities from configuration loading to mathematical computations and file operations in the context of Quantum Error Mitigation (QEM).
        • Subpackages

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils

This file contains helper functions to work with noncommutative polynomials and Hamiltonians.

Created on Thu May 2 16:03:05 2013

@author: Peter Wittek

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.count_ncmonomials(monomials, degree)

Given a list of monomials, it counts those that have a certain degree, or less. The function is useful when certain monomials were eliminated from the basis.

Parameters:

  • variables – The noncommutative variables making up the monomials

  • monomials – List of monomials (the monomial basis).

  • degree – Maximum degree to count.

Returns:

The count of appropriate monomials.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.apply_substitutions(monomial, monomial_substitutions, pure=False)

Helper function to remove monomials from the basis.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.fast_substitute(monomial, old_sub, new_sub)

Experimental fast substitution routine that considers only restricted cases of noncommutative algebras. In rare cases, it fails to find a substitution. Use it with proper testing.

Parameters:

  • monomial – The monomial with parts need to be substituted.

  • old_sub – The part to be replaced.

  • new_sub – The replacement.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.generate_variables(name, n_vars=1, hermitian=None, commutative=True)

Generates a number of commutative or noncommutative variables

Parameters:

  • name (str.) – The prefix in the symbolic representation of the noncommuting variables. This will be suffixed by a number from 0 to n_vars-1 if n_vars > 1.

  • n_vars (int.) – The number of variables.

  • hermitian (bool.) – Optional parameter to request Hermitian variables .

  • commutative (bool.) – Optional parameter to request commutative variables. Commutative variables are Hermitian by default.

Returns:

list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator variables or sympy.Symbol

Example:

>>> generate_variables('y', 2, commutative=True)
￼[y0, y1]
qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.generate_operators(name, n_vars=1, hermitian=None, commutative=False)

Generates a number of commutative or noncommutative operators

Parameters:

  • name (str.) – The prefix in the symbolic representation of the noncommuting variables. This will be suffixed by a number from 0 to n_vars-1 if n_vars > 1.

  • n_vars (int.) – The number of variables.

  • hermitian (bool.) – Optional parameter to request Hermitian variables .

  • commutative (bool.) – Optional parameter to request commutative variables. Commutative variables are Hermitian by default.

Returns:

list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator variables

Example:

>>> generate_variables('y', 2, commutative=True)
￼[y0, y1]
qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.get_monomials(variables, degree)

Generates all noncommutative monomials up to a degree

Parameters:

  • variables (list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator.) – The noncommutative variables to generate monomials from

  • degree (int.) – The maximum degree.

Returns:

list of monomials.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.ncdegree(polynomial)

Returns the degree of a noncommutative polynomial.

Parameters:

polynomial (sympy.core.expr.Expr.) – Polynomial of noncommutive variables.

Returns:

int – the degree of the polynomial.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.nc_utils.iscomplex(polynomial)

Returns whether the polynomial has complex coefficients

Parameters:

polynomial (sympy.core.expr.Expr.) – Polynomial of noncommutive variables.

Returns:

bool – whether there is a complex coefficient.

Save a monomial dictionary for debugging purposes.

Parameters:

  • monomial_index (dict of sympy.core.expr.Expr.) – The monomial index of the SDP relaxation.
